items.title: Volatile week for markets: Sensex sheds 1.3%, FIIs continue selling as geopolitical tensions rise
items.description: For the week, the BSE Sensex index shed 1,070.39 points or 1.3 percent to end at 81,118.60, and Nifty50 fell 284.45 points or 1.13 percent to close at 24,718.60.

items.title: Market ends lower amid geopolitical tensions; realty, PSU Bank major drag
items.description: The Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) extended their selling in fourth straight week as they sold equities worth Rs 1,246.51 crore. On the other hand, Domestic Institutional Investors (DII) continued their buying in eight consecutive week as they bought equities worth Rs 18,637.29 crore.

items.title: Wall Street ends sharply lower as Iran retaliates against Israel attack
items.description: The S&P 500 declined 1.13% to end the session at 5,976.97 points. The Nasdaq declined 1.30% to 19,406.83 points, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average declined 1.79% to 42,197.79 points.
